details.title: COVID-19 UPDATES FROM NOV 24
details.content: Odisha not to lower guard even after vaccines are available, says CM Naveen Patnaik and more updates from across India. (CLICK HERE FOR NOV 14 UPDATES)

details.title: Congress veteran Ahmed Patel passes away following COVID complications
details.content:
Senior Congress leader Ahmed Patel, who was undergoing treatment at a Gurugram hospital after testing positive for the COVID-19, breathed his last after multi-organ failure in the wee hours of Wednesday, his son Faisal confirmed. He was 71. 
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Delhi's biggest graveyard running out of burial space with rise in COVID-19 deaths
details.content:
''There should be some arrangement so that COVID-19 victims are buried at graveyards in their neighbourhoods and their relatives do not have to come here because space is limited,'' said Haji Mian Faiyazuddin, secretary of Qabristan Ahle Islam in the vicinity of the walled city.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: IN PICS | Mandatory COVID-19 tests for travellers coming from a few states into Maharashtra
details.content:
Maharashtra: Travellers from Delhi, Rajasthan, Goa and Gujarat arriving at Mumbai to undergo mandatory RT-PCR test from today; visuals Dadar Railway station pic.twitter.com/7vBmuqOTCG

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Sans proper safety gear, teachers on COVID-19 survey duty fear infection in Capital
details.content:
School teachers deployed in the forefront of Delhi government’s latest fight against Covid-19 are complaining about risk of infection in the absence of adequate safeguards such as N-95 masks and face shields in their house-to-house surveys.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: COVID patient on life support system stuck in Nepal saved at Delhi's Max hospital
details.content:
A team of Max Saket doctors who specially flew down to Kathmandu for a 37-year-old critically-ill Covid pneumonia patient on ECMO machine from Nepal and shifted him to the city hospital. 
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Telangana adds 993 fresh COVID-19 cases to its tally
details.content:
Telangana reported 993 new #COVID19 cases, 4 deaths and 1,150 recoveries on 24th November.

Total cases in the state rise to 2,66,042 including 1,441 deaths and 2,53,715 recoveries.

Active cases stand at 10,886

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Being safe amid new COVID normal is of utmost importance: Padma Bhushan awardee tells students
details.content:
The not-for-profit NIIT University (NU) hosted the 12th annual lecture delivered by Dr Naresh Trehan, who is a Padma Bhushan awardee, and founder & chairman of Medanta Medicity. Dr Trehan spoke on ‘Building Your Future in COVID Times’ at the annual event held online recently.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: India adds 44,376 new cases to its tally, 481 deaths in last 24 hours
Meet the digital warriors who are keeping Kerala panchayat polls engaging in COVID times
details.content:
While UDF bets on pros, LDF has cyber wings -- mostly students and youths as members -- in every panchayat to create shareable content for their candidates
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: No congregation on Kartika Purnima in view of COVID-19
details.content:
Odisha Government on Tuesday prohibited congregation at river ghats and water bodies and imposed restriction on mass bathing on the occasion of Kartika Purnima on November 30 in view of Covid-19 pandemic.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

Maharashtra: #COVID19 tests being done on passengers arriving from Delhi, Goa, Rajasthan & Gujarat

"Passengers who've COVID negative certificates are allowed to go while rest are checked for symptoms & tested accordingly," says BMC doctor

Visuals- Mumbai Central Railway Station pic.twitter.com/Vs7InmAyIN

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Oxford COVID-19 results reason for hope but early days yet, caution scientists
details.content:
There is plenty to be hopeful about and the Oxford AstraZeneca is a good option to begin with, but it is also important to remember the numbers are tentative and a full analysis is difficult, several scientists said.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: India's COVID-19 caseload goes past 92 lakh; number of active infections increases by 6,079
details.content:
India's COVID-19 caseload went past 92 lakh with 44,376 new cases reported in a day, while the number of recoveries surged to 86.42 lakh, the health ministry said on Wednesday. The number of total coronavirus cases rose to 92,22,216 in the country, while the death toll due to the disease climbed to 1,34,699 with 481 new fatalities, the ministry's data updated at 8 am showed.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Senior Congress leader Ahmed Patel passed away due to post-covid complications
details.content:
Mortal remains of Congress leader #AhmedPatel will be taken to his native place in Gujarat's Bharuch where his last rites will be performed. pic.twitter.com/uIqXPm1Iey

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Explainer: China's controversial claims of COVID-19 on imported frozen foods
details.content: While experts say the virus can survive for a time on cardboard and plastic containers, it remains unclear how serious a risk that poses. Like so many issues surrounding the pandemic, the matter has swiftly become politicised. (READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 vaccine: Envoys from 100 countries to visit Pune on December 4
details.content:
Ambassadors and envoys from 100 countries will visit Serum Institute of India and Gennova Biopharmaceuticals Ltd here on December 4 amid the coronavirus outbreak and race for vaccines to combat the infection, a senior official said.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

The United States Government, through the US Agency for International Development (USAID), is donating 15 ventilators to Bhutan to assist the country in its fight against #COVID19: US Embassy & Consulates in India

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Covid test mandatory at Uttarakhand airport for people coming from Delhi
details.content:
With this announcement, Uttarakhand has joined states like Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, which have mandated the COVID-19 test for people arriving from Delhi.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Aurangabad records 146 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: The detection of 146 fresh cases of COVID-19 has raised the count of infections in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district to 42,646, an official said on Wednesday. With the addition of the latest cases on Tuesday, the district now has 802 patients undergoing treatment, the official said.

details.title: Night curfew to be imposed in Punjab from December 1 to fight coronavirus: CM Amarinder Singh
details.content: Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh on Wednesday said a night curfew will be imposed in the state from December 1 to fight coronavirus. The chief minister in a statement said the night curfew will remain in force from 10 pm and 5 am, amid apprehension of a second wave of coronavirus in the state. (READ MORE)

details.title: Consistent fall in cumulative COVID-19 positivity rate as testing increases
details.content: With the total number of tests conducted for the detection of COVID-19 nearing 13.5 crore in the country, the health ministry on Wednesday said comprehensive and widespread testing on a sustained basis has resulted in bringing down the positivity rate.

details.title: Kejriwal asks experts to audit COVID-19 death cases, suggest measures to reduce fatalities in Delhi
details.content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday requested experts to audit COVID-19 death cases and suggest measures to reduce fatalities in the national capital, amid a spurt in the infections in the city.

details.title: Bihar reported 763 new COVID-19 infections on 24th November
details.content: Bihar reported 763 new COVID-19 infections on 24th November, taking total active cases in the state to 5,779.

details.title: Dehradun district magistrate asks all SDMs/city magistrate to ensure strict compliance
details.content: Dehradun district magistrate asks all SDMs/city magistrate to ensure strict compliance of weekend closure of commercial establishments.

details.title: All hotels, restaurants and wedding venues in Punjab to close at 9.30 pm starting December 1
details.content: All hotels, restaurants and wedding venues in Punjab to close at 9.30 pm, starting December 1. Curbs to be reviewed on December 15.

details.title: District authorities setting up micro-containment zones as COVID-19 cases surge in Delhi
details.content: Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in the national capital, some district authorities have been setting up micro-containment zones where two or more infections have been reported for better management of the pandemic, officials said on Wednesday. Normally, an area is marked containment zone where three or more COVID-19 cases are detected.

details.title: MHA issues fresh guidelines for surveillance, containment and caution
details.content: Ministry of Home Affairs issues fresh guidelines for surveillance, containment and caution. States/ UTs mandated to strictly enforce containment measures, SOPs on various activities and COVID-appropriate behavior and exercise caution and regulate crowds.

details.title: Only essential activities allowed in Containment Zones: MHA
details.content: Only essential activities allowed in Containment Zones. Local district, police & municipal authorities shall be responsible to ensure that prescribed Containment measures are strictly followed & State/UT Govts shall ensure accountability of concerned officers: MHA

details.title: MCDs allege under-reporting of COVID deaths in Delhi, AAP accuses BJP of 'politicising' issue
details.content: The three BJP-ruled municipal corporations here Wednesday again alleged the AAP-led Delhi government was under-reporting deaths due to coronavirus, a claim refuted by the ruling party which accused the MCDs of 'politicising' the issue.

details.title: States can impose local restrictions under MHA's new  guidelines, but with Centre's approval
details.content:
States and union territories can impose local restrictions like night curfew to check the spread of COVID-19, but they will have to consult the Centre before imposing any lockdown outside the containment zones, the Ministry of Home Affairs said on Wednesday.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: How Tamil Nadu is battling COVID-19 and cyclone Nivar
details.content:
Medical teams hold fever camps at temporary shelters, distribute masks:
In order to ensure the safety of inmates of temporary shelters set up for evacuees in the wake of Cyclone Nivar, medical teams are holding fever camps at these shelters and distributing masks.
(READ ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir adds 489 new cases to its COVID-19 tally
details.content:
Jammu and Kashmir report 489 new COVID-19 cases, 570 recoveries, and 12 deaths.

Total cases - 1,07,819

Active cases - 5,264

Total recoveries - 1,00,892

Total deaths - 1,663 pic.twitter.com/wqIGHlMYCI

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Centre asks states to take steps to reopen medical colleges from or before December 1
details.content: The Union Health Ministry Wednesday asked state governments to initiate steps for reopening of medical colleges from December 1 or before it, but with strict adherence to all COVID-19 related guidelines. Educational institutions in the country have been closed since March in view of the coronavirus pandemic.

details.title: Late hospital admissions, rising pollution behind surge in COVID-19 deaths in Delhi, says experts
details.content: Late hospital admissions leading to COVID-19 cases turning critical, shortage of ICU beds, unfavourable weather and rising pollution are among the factors experts attribute to the spike in COVID-19 deaths in Delhi.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh COVID Updates
details.content:
Andhra Pradesh reported 831 new #COVID19 cases, 1,176 recovered cases & 6 deaths in the last 24 hours.

Taking the total positive cases in the state to 8,64,674, including 12,673 active cases, 8,45,039 recovered cases & 6,962 deaths in the state: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/bj3Codpca6

— ANI (@ANI) November 25, 2020

details.title: Bombay High Court quashes woman's FIR against doctor husband over COVID-19 duty
details.content: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday quashed an FIR filed by a woman against her doctor husband, after she told the court that the move was a result of stress due to long hours of COVID-19 duty.

details.title: Bengal's leader of Opposition Abdul Mannan COVID-positive, admitted to hospital
details.content: West Bengal's Leader of Opposition Abdul Mannan tested positive for COVID-19, following which he was admitted to a private hospital in Kolkata, state Health Department officials said on Wednesday.

details.title: Gujarat reports 1,540 new COVID19 cases, 14 deaths and 1,283 recoveries
details.content: Gujarat reports 1,540 new COVID19 cases, 14 deaths and 1,283 recoveries. The state's case tally reaches 2,01,949 including 1,83,756 recoveries and 3,906 deaths till now. Total active cases are 14,287: State Health Department

details.title: Uttarakhand tally
details.content: Uttarakhand reports 482 new COVID-19 cases taking the total number of cases to 72,642: State Control Room

details.title: Bengal's leader of opposition Abdul Mannan COVID-positive
details.content: Mannan (68), a veteran leader of the Congress in the state, got himself tested for COVID-19 on Tuesday after noticing some symptoms, they said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Maharashtra tally
details.content:
Maharashtra reports 6,159 new COVID-19 cases, 4,844 recoveries, and 65 deaths, says State Health Departement

  • Total cases: 17,95,959
  • Total recoveries: 16,63,723
  • Active cases: 84,464
  • Death toll: 46,748

details.title: Uttar Pradesh records 29 more COVID-19 deaths, 2,318 new cases
details.content: With 2,318 fresh COVID-19 cases in Uttar Pradesh, the infection tally in the state rose to 5,33,355 on Wednesday, while 29 more fatalities pushed the death toll to 7,644, a health department bulletin said.

details.title: Kullu imposes fine for violators
details.content: Wearing of face cover/face masks shall be compulsory in public places, people defying the order shall be liable for fine of Rs 1000 which can be extended to Rs 5000: Kullu District Administration, Himachal Pradeh

details.title: Delhi tally
details.content:
Delhi reported 5,246 new COVID-19 cases, 5,361 recoveries, and 99 deaths in the last 24 hours.

  • Total cases: 5,45,787
  • Total recoveries: 4,98,780
  • Active cases: 38,287
  • Death toll: 8,720

details.title: Chembarambakkam reservoir water release increased
details.content:
At around 6 pm on Wednesday, the release of water from Chembarambakkam reservoir was stepped up to 5,000 cusecs.

With heavy rainfall, the inflow into the lake was 4,980 cusecs.

details.title: Assam tally
details.content: Assam reports 182 new COVID-19 cases and 117 discharges today. Total cases in the State now at 2,12,021 including 2,07,763 recoveries, 3,277 active cases, and 978 deaths: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma
